title: DSA Level 5 — Stacks & Queues
concept: Stack operations, queue operations, balanced parentheses, next greater element, sliding window.

challenges.title: Implement Stack
challenges.description: Perform Q stack operations: PUSH X and POP. After all operations, print the remaining stack from bottom to top.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: Q. Next Q lines: operations.
challenges.outputDescription: Elements from bottom to top or "Empty".
examples:
Input:
5
PUSH 3
PUSH 5
POP
PUSH 2
PUSH 8

Output:
3 2 8

challenges.title: Implement Queue
challenges.description: Perform Q queue operations (ENQUEUE X or DEQUEUE). After operations, print queue from front to back.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: Q. Next Q lines: operations.
examples:
Input:
5
ENQUEUE 1
ENQUEUE 2
DEQUEUE
ENQUEUE 3
ENQUEUE 4

Output:
2 3 4

challenges.title: Balanced Parentheses
challenges.description: Given a bracket string, check if it is balanced using stack.

challenges.title: Next Greater Element
challenges.description: For each array element, find the next greater element to its right. If none, print -1.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Previous Greater Element
challenges.description: For each element, find the closest greater element to its left; if none, print -1.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Largest Rectangle in Histogram
challenges.description: Given heights of histogram bars, return area of largest rectangle.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Sliding Window Maximum
challenges.description: Given an array and window size K, print the maximum in every window.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N K. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: First Non-Repeating Character in Stream
challenges.description: Characters arrive in a stream; after each insertion, print the first non-repeating character or -1.
examples:
Input:
aabc

Output:
a -1 b b

challenges.title: Queue Using Two Stacks
challenges.description: Implement a queue using two stacks. Print final queue contents.
challenges.inputDescription: Operations similar to normal queue format.

challenges.title: Sort a Stack Using Recursion
challenges.description: Sort a stack in non-decreasing order using only recursion (no extra data structures).
challenges.outputDescription: Sorted stack from bottom to top.
